author: Sebastian Kaliszewski
comment: Works great!                       I dropped my phone and its screen died. That day I made quite a bit of photos but I had wifi off on my phone and photos were set to backup on wifi only. Tried to enable wifi in blind (touch still worked) but to no avail.  Then I thought there must be an app for my watch to control phone wifi remotely. I went to Play Store on my laptop and I found this app pretty fast. A click and 5m later it was installed on my phone & wear.                         The app saved my photos! I've enabled wifi from my watch, and photos started backing up immediately!   Few tens of my photos from an one time event would be otherwise lost, as the damaged phone is encrypted.

author: Tyler Workman
comment: Got it thinking it would work with ease. First WiFi turned on but then wouldn't turn off and there's no direct way that it states to shut off wifi, tried turning on wifi and it doesn't work period.. Maybe better luck if they created location service on and off. Update: received an email from the developer explaining toggle is the on/off for wifi, which is more obvious. Still the toggle is leggy and shows no slash mark on the wifi connection to show disabled. The wifi turns off and immediately back on.

reply.author: DMB
reply.content: Hi Tyler. Thanks for your feedback. I'd like to work with you further to solve this issue. We wish to make every effort to ensure a smooth and robust user experience. From your description, it's unclear specifically what problem you are facing, which makes it difficult to solve. Please email us at wifimanager@denley.me to discuss further.

title: Not smart enough for s5

author: Tan Anh Nguyen
comment: Developer responses really fast on bug reports and fixes them very quickly. Great support

reply.author: DMB
reply.content: Hi Tuan. Thanks very much for bringing this issue to my attention. I have just released an update that fixes it. Please let me know if you find any other issues.

title: Good App , works great

author: Oliver Charity
comment: Great app. Just what I needed to choose between my dual band networks. I wish I could also choose what Bluetooth to connect as I have headphones and Bluetooth speakers around. Great work.
title: A+, really great app, functionality and design

author: Brian salmon
comment: It doesn't play well with Android 5.0

reply.author: DMB
reply.content: Hi. Thanks for your interest in this app, and for your feedback. This app was actually primarily developed and tested on Android 5.0 (Nexus 5) and also tested on 4.4 and 4.3 to ensure compatibility. Please send an email to wifimanager@denley.me with some details of your issue(s) so that I can look into it further. Thanks again.
